title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek has signed a new contract to continue as the Red Sox's game-planning and run prevention coach for 2026.
Varitek cited the team's leadership and roster potential, including rookies like catcher Carlos Narvaez, as reasons for staying.
Narvaez, a Gold Glove finalist, threw out 32 potential base stealers and batted .241 with 15 home runs in 2025.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookie Kyle Williams scored his first career touchdown in New England's 28-23 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams combined for 222 of New England's 435 total offensive yards against Tampa.
Patriots' offensive line rookies Will Campbell and Jared Wilson helped limit Buccaneers to one sack in the game.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads the NFL MVP race with odds of +250 according to FanDuel and DraftKings.
Maye contributed 270 passing yards and two touchdowns in Patriots' 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Maye has 2,555 passing yards, 19 touchdowns, and five interceptions this season, with two rushing touchdowns.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract with the New England Patriots to officially retire as a Patriot.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with the Patriots, winning three Super Bowls and setting franchise records in receiving touchdowns.
After retiring from the NFL in 2022, Gronkowski works at Fox Sports and co-hosts a podcast with Julian Edelman.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored key touchdowns, contributing to a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Rookie Elijah Ponder recorded his first career sack, affecting a crucial fourth-quarter play against Baker Mayfield.
Drake Maye's completion rate fell to 51%, though he led the Patriots to victory using key deep plays.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to seven with a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams contribute three touchdowns, accounting for 222 yards.
Quarterback Drake Maye throws two touchdowns but also an interception, completing 16-of-31 for 270 yards.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, was arrested for alleged drunk driving after crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty to charges including operating under the influence and was released on personal recognizance.
Daveiga is on 'modified duty' pending his Dec. 19 court date, following alleged intoxication and refusal to take a breathalyzer test.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits detained by ICE on November 4 during federal operation.
Department of Homeland Security claims the employees entered the U.S. illegally, despite them having work permits.
Local officials and advocacy groups express outrage, offering legal support and calling the detentions cruel and unjust.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted the November 8 episode of 'Saturday Night Live' during its 51st season.
Musical guest Sombr performed, marking the fifth episode of 'SNL's' current season.
Pete Davidson returned to 'Weekend Update' during Glaser's hosting episode featuring several skit highlights.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial third-period goal, sealing a 5-3 Bruins win over the Maple Leafs in Toronto.
Minten, once a top prospect for Toronto, was traded to the Bruins last season in exchange for Brandon Carlo.
Bruins head coach Marco Sturm praised Minten, calling him the 'best player on the ice' during the victory.
